Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Applicant joined AUC after losing cocaine and participated in violent activities
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Joined after loss of cocaine, engaged in violence, claimed duress
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Actions inconsistent with fear of imminent peril
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Duress claim dismissed due to lack of imminence
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Timing and nature of actions post-joining
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board found applicant not credible on duress
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Discrepancy between claimed duress and conduct
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Article 31 of the Rome Statute, Canadian case law, IRPA
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Duress requires imminent physical peril, no reasonable alternative, proportionality
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Rejected duress defense, found voluntary membership
Crimes.Process: Admissibility hearing followed by judicial review
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged error in rejecting duress defense

Crimes.Crime_Name: Participating in activities of a terrorist group
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether duress defense was wrongly rejected
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant joined AUC after losing cocaine, participated in violence, fled later, sought refugee protection
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Participation in AUC activities despite alleged duress
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged duress from threat following loss of drugs
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Duress under IRPA: imminent peril, no alternative, proportionality
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Conduct inconsistent with duress, existence of escape options
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Challenge to procedural fairness or legal error in Board’s assessment
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Duress claim not accepted due to lack of imminence
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Applicant's testimony, record of AUC involvement
Crimes.Application_Basis: Inadmissibility under terrorism provisions of IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Actions post-joining AUC weighed against duress claim
Crimes.Governing_Rule: IRPA s. 34(1)(b) – participation in terrorist activity
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to prove imminence and lack of alternatives
Crimes.Outcome: Remains inadmissible and subject to deportation
Crimes.Cause_Description: Involvement with AUC led to inadmissibility in Canada
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Board assessed credibility and consistency of conduct
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Credibility gap between claimed duress and prolonged involvement
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No imminent peril, plausible escape routes existed
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Credibility and consistency of applicant's account
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Duress defense standard under Canadian administrative law
